title: Larry David
summary: Lawrence Gene David (born July 2, 1947)[1] is an American comedian, writer, actor, director, and television producer.[2] He and Jerry Seinfeld created the television series Seinfeld, on which David was head writer and executive producer for the first seven seasons. He gained further recognition for the HBO series Curb Your Enthusiasm, which he created and stars in as a semi-fictionalized version of himself. He has written or co-written the stories of every episode of the improvisational comedy Curb Your Enthusiasm since its pilot episode in 1999.[3]
